port_scanner.chunker module¶

This module provides functions and a class PortChunker for feeding chunks of ports to a port scanner.

exception port_scanner.chunker.ChunkBoundsError(lower, upper)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

class port_scanner.chunker.PortChunker(port_list)[source]¶

Bases: object

This object is initialized with a collection of ports(integers) that it splits up into distinct non-overlapping pools(sets). The member method get_chunk() draws from the pools according to preferences. Designed to be called by port_scanner.scanner.PortScanner to scan chunks of ports at a time.

Parameters:port_list (collection) – Collection of ports to form the basis of the pools.
fist_class_pool¶

A pool of very popular ports that a scanner would want to check first.

second_class_pool¶

A pool of popular ports that a scanner would want to check early in the process.

main_pool¶

A pool of ports that aren’t first class or second class.

get_chunk(lower_bound=10, upper_bound=20)[source]¶

Return a randomized chunk(list) of ports from the various instance pools. Ensure ports in chunk are no longer in the pool drawn from.

Parameters:
  • lower_bound – The suggested lower bound on the size of a chunk from the main pool. Also the suggested upper bound on a chunk drawing from a first or second-class pool.
  • upper_bound – The hard upper bound on the size of any chunk returned.
Returns:

A randomized chunk(list) of ports from the various instance pools.
exception port_scanner.chunker.RemovalError(port)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

port_scanner.chunker.bounds_are_valid(lower, upper)[source]¶
port_scanner.chunker.draw_from_pool(port_pool, size)[source]¶

Return a random sample of ports from a pool, and remove those ports from the pool.

Parameters:
  • port_pool (set) – The pool of ports to draw from.
  • size (int) – The desired size of the drawing. If size is bigger than the pool, the pool will be completely drained.
Returns:

Random sample of ports from the pool.
port_scanner.chunker.port_is_valid(port)[source]¶
port_scanner.chunker.port_pool_is_empty(port_pool)[source]¶

Check whether a port pool is empty.

port_scanner.chunker.port_set_intersection(port_set_1, port_set_2)[source]¶

Return the intersection of two sets of ports(integers).

port_scanner.chunker.random_chunk_size(lower_bound, upper_bound)[source]¶

Return a random integer between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Raises:ChunkBoundsError – if bounds are invalid.
port_scanner.chunker.remove_ports_from_pool(ports_to_remove, port_pool)[source]¶

Remove ports from a pool(set) of ports.

Parameters:
  • ports_to_remove (collection) – iterable collection of ports to remove.
  • port_pool (set) – pool to remove from.
Raises:

RemovalError – if a port isn’t in the pool to begin with.
port_scanner.chunker.validate_port_list(port_list)[source]¶

Filter out invalid (out of bounds) ports from list.
